about.about_me: I have worked on projects at every stage: from gathering initial requirements to deploying a finished product. My code is efficient and clean. I am skilled at applying OO design principles and ensuring maximum re-usability of components. User-friendly and intuitive user interfaces are a must with any client-facing technology. My skills lie in creating intuitive, bug-free, and modern GUIs. My front-end framework of choice is React for web development and React Native for mobile app development.

experience.name: Jr Tech Lead - Umuzi.org
experience.comment: Umuzi is a non-profit that finds high-potential young people, trains them in high-value digital skills, and launches their careers. My responsibilities include: Supervise team members from a lower cohort, help team members resolve technical blockers and conflicts, delegate and advice on tasks, issue feedback and evaluate risk

badges.name: Double-Checked
badges.comment: Updated a design more than 5 times to improve its presentation quality - Developers with this badge are likely to double check and confirm their work

badges.name: Single Shot
badges.comment: Updated a project only once - Developers with this badge are able to follow guidelines or work brief in advance to prevent time delay during projects.

badges.name: Peer Recognition
badges.comment: Other developers liked the project of the developer - Developers with this badge are able to write high quality code that appeals to the aesthetic taste of developers in general

badges.name: Spotter
badges.comment: The developer has identified an issue with the system, figured out a glitch or suggested an improvement to an existing function by taking part in our code bounty program.

projects.name: Morse code
projects.description: This is program that has two functions, it  can convert morse code to numbers, letters of the alphabets and special characters, and it can convert numbers, special characters and letters of the alphabets to morse code

projects.name: Consume Github API
projects.description: The function outputs a list or array of pull requests on the repo such that the PRs were created, updated, merged or closed between the given two dates. For each PR include the id, user (who opened the PR), title, state, and when it was created. While for private repos a token will be required, the function should be able to work on public repos (eg. ACN-syllabus) without needing a token.

projects.name: Semitone difference
projects.description: This program lets a user get two random notes from the note circle and input the distance betweeen the notes. It tells you when you are correct and when you are incorrect and also allows you to reveal the answer.

projects.name: Shop Database using sql
projects.description: This program is written to create a database called 'shop' with 5 tables (customer, employees, orders, payments and products) from which the following is queried -SELECT ALL records from table Customers SELECT records only from the name column in the Customers table, Show the name of the Customer whose CustomerID is 1, UPDATE the record for CustomerID = 1 on the Customer table so that the name is “Lerato Mabitso”, DELETE the record from the Customers table for customer 2 (CustomerID = 2), Select all unique statuses from the Orders table and get a count of the number of orders for each unique status, Return the MAXIMUM payment made on the PAYMENTS table, Select all customers from the “Customers” table, sorted by the “Country” column, Select all products with a price BETWEEN R100 and R600, Select all fields from “Customers” where the country is “Germany” AND the city is “Berlin”, Select all fields from “Customers” where the city is “Cape Town” OR “Durban”, Select all records from Products where the Price is GREATER than R500, Return the sum of the Amounts on the Payments table, Count the number of shipped orders in the Orders table, Return the average price of all Products, in Rands and Dollars (assume the exchange rate is R12 to the Dollar), Using INNER JOIN create a query that selects all Payments with Customer information, Select all products that have turnable front wheels.

projects.name: Memory Game
projects.description: This a memory game app in which a user tries to match images that look the same. The game has 3 features, a timer that telss you how long you took to match all cards, a configurable grid size that allows you to choose from different sizes and a filp counter that tells you how many times you flipped the cards to match them all

projects.name: Email Random Inspirational Quote
projects.description: This program sends a random inspirational quote to the email that is parsed to it

projects.name: Node File IO
projects.description: This is a program that allows you to create a new visitor, update the visitor, delete the visitor, view the visitor, get all the visitors, get the last visitor and delete all the visitors in a database.

projects.name: My Portfolio
projects.description: A public profile page that can act as a kind of portfolio. This page can be sent out to potential employers and make the job hunt easier.

projects.name: React and Redux recipe search
projects.description: I used React and Redux to build a kick-ass web app for searchung for recipes, This webapp uses edamam's API to fetch recipes and displays the relevant information for the user.

projects.name: Military game
projects.description: Millitary game is a game in which the player has to kill all the enemies to accumulate points at each stage, without being killed three times.

projects.name: QR conference connector
projects.description: This an app that utilizes the phones camera to scan qr predefined codes and save the valid information to the phones database. You can add a note, favourite and delete a contact from the database

projects.name: Simple variometer
projects.description: This native app enables a paraglyder to glance at their phone and quickly see information about their position, speed and heading. The display is very easy to read and high contrast because the pilot will likely be outside in the sun. The phone will be on the plot's lap so the display will need to be easy to read from that distance. The display shows if the pilot is accelerating upwards or downwards.
